Constructor Detail

Kcount

public Kcount()
Method Detail

getK

public int getK()
Returns the pattern length K that this Kcount handles (i.e. the number of symbols per word being counted)

Returns:
the pattern length

getNumberOfBins

public int getNumberOfBins()
Returns the number of bins, which is the number of possible patterns in this Kcount. Typically this will the alphabet size to the power of K. Assuming a straightforward implementation, this will equal getCounts().size().

Returns:
The number of bins

getOriginalSequenceLength

public long getOriginalSequenceLength()
Returns the length of the sequence that was scanned to produce this spectrum. This number may be greater than that given by #getNumberOfSamples() because every symbol is not necessarily counted as a sample, depending on the implementation.

Specified by:
getOriginalSequenceLength in interface SequenceSpectrum<T extends Kcount>
Returns:
the length (type int) of this Kcount object.
See Also:
addUnknown()

getUnknownCount

public long getUnknownCount()
Description copied from interface: SequenceSpectrum
Returns the number of characters from the original sequence that were not counted because they were unknown

Specified by:
getUnknownCount in interface SequenceSpectrum<T extends Kcount>

addUnknown

public void addUnknown()
Adds an "unknown" sample to this kcount, indicating that a character was consumed without incrementing any counter.

unknownProportion

public double unknownProportion()

getSumOfCounts

public abstract double getSumOfCounts()
Returns the the sum of the counts. May be completely different from the number of samples due to smoothing or normalization. Even for raw counts, this may be greater than the number of samples due to pseudocounts. May differ on different levels of a Kcount due to lastwords.

hasParent

public boolean hasParent()
